body_html: Actually I just realized that submodules might be a viable option, because we could just modify the .gitmodules in the PyTorch repo, and create aten/.gitmodules manually too (with the paths patched up). This would let the standalone ATen repo download Catch from git as well
body_text: Actually I just realized that submodules might be a viable option, because we could just modify the .gitmodules in the PyTorch repo, and create aten/.gitmodules manually too (with the paths patched up). This would let the standalone ATen repo download Catch from git as well
body: Actually I just realized that submodules might be a viable option, because we could just modify the `.gitmodules` in the PyTorch repo, and create `aten/.gitmodules` manually too (with the paths patched up). This would let the standalone ATen repo download Catch from `git` as well
